content.location: The obvious seam on the trailside face.

content.description: Crimpy whichever way you go. Climb the short face farther left or further right.

Easiest route up, and also the safest down-climb route.

 Climb the less-than-vertical face using the crisp left arete, big positive jugs, and ledges wide enough to climb it even if you didnt bring climbing shoes because your broken rib wasn’t yet 100% healed and you’re in poorly fitting running shoes
content.location: Looking from the trail, at the right end of the boulder on the far side.

content.description: Slightly overhanging face between two aretes The right arete is fairly sharp with good holds, left arete is slopey with trickier feet.  Hand sized crack in between

pathTokens: Burr Pond State Park / Paugnut State Forest

content.description:
Perfect warm up boulder and one of the first that you’ll come across if you enter from the main Burr Pond parking lot.  Easy access directly on a seldom-used trail with no bushwhacking, and the landing area is flat, level and clear.  Variety of roufes to warm up everyone from including v0, v2-3 and harder sit-starts that could be v4-6+

Large pink granitic gneiss erratic, approximately 12’ high right along an un-blazed mountain bike trail. Side adjacent to trail has sight overhanging bump out with much more challenging routes. Opposite side is less than verical with easier routes and positive holds. One end has a nice arete.
